snippet: Despite the soda industry’s expensive campaign against a one-cent tax per ounce on sugary soda in Berkeley, Calif., and a similar effort in San Francisco, officials hope to set a precedent for the nation.
abstract: Berkeley, Calif, has become a last stand for the anti-sugar movement; at issue is proposed 1-cent tax per ounce on sugary drinks going before voters in November; beverage industry has invested $1.4 million to block effort, but city has history of pioneering civic activism and proponents measure are hopeful.
lead_paragraph: Despite the soda industry’s expensive campaign against a one-cent tax per ounce on sugary soda in Berkeley, Calif., and a similar effort in San Francisco, officials hope to set a precedent for the nation.

headline.main: Berkeley Officials Outspent but Optimistic in Battle Over Soda Tax
headline.print_headline: Berkeley Officials Outspent but Optimistic in Battle Over Soda Tax
